Name: The Feynman Lectures on Physics, Vol. II: The New Millennium Edition: Mainly Electromagnetism and Matter (Volume 2)

ReviewList.Text: This series of books covers everything an undergraduate would learn when taking a physics course! I was so excited to see how complete these books are. Although you do need a background in mathematics (which I have) due to the fact that Calculus and probability is used.

I wish I had these books at the start of college! Feynman has an explicit way of making a difficult subject perfectly clear. He uses parallels, meaning he will use common every day objects to explain physics problem. Then, he will apply the actual physics. I highly recommend this to anyone and everyone who loves and enjoys physics.

It's a good alternative to the confusing required text for my Electromagnetics class (Fundamentals of Applied Electromagnetics 6th Edition)... If you can read it before the semester begins I would recommend it, because I haven't been able to read the whole thing but I've loved what I've read so far!
Easy to read, not a whole lot of math. Recommended for anyone taking an electromagnetics course. Highly recommended for college students.
Great buy for the physics buff.
It was a gift to my husband. He enjoyed vol 1.  He is looking forward to reading  his present Vol. 2.
